title: 106_hr2341
content: The "Safety Net Preservation Act of 1999" may be cited as the short title. It introduces a new prospective payment system for federally-qualified health centers and rural health clinics. The "Safety Net Preservation Act of 1999" introduces a new prospective payment system for federally-qualified health centers and rural health clinics, allowing payment for specific services under the plan in accordance with subsection (aa). The State plan starting from fiscal year 2000 must include payment for services provided by Federally-qualified health centers and rural health clinics. For services in fiscal year 2000, payment should be based on the costs of furnishing services in fiscal year 1999 or other reasonable tests as prescribed by the Secretary. The State plan must include payment for services provided by Federally-qualified health centers and rural health clinics. For new centers or clinics qualifying after fiscal year 1999, payment for services in the first fiscal year should be equal to 100 on a per visit basis. The State plan outlines payment for services provided by Federally-qualified health centers and rural health clinics. Payment is calculated based on the previous year's amount, adjusted for any increase in services provided. For new centers or clinics qualifying after fiscal year 1999, payment in the first fiscal year is equal to 100 percent on a per visit basis. In the case of services provided under a managed care contract, payment is made at least quarterly. The State plan includes payment to Federally-qualified health centers and rural health clinics based on services provided. Payment may be supplemented quarterly to cover any amount exceeding the contract payments. Alternative payment methodologies can be used if agreed upon by the State and the center/clinic. The State plan involves payment to Federally-qualified health centers and rural health clinics based on services provided, with the option for additional quarterly supplementation. Amendments to related sections of the Balanced Budget Act of 1997 and the Social Security Act are made, with an effective date of October 1, 1999.
